subject: linear_algebra
title: Cofactor Expansion
statementHtml: Given a square matrix A, expand its determinant along any row or column using cofactors.
hints: Start by selecting the row or column you want to expand along.
Find the minor of the selected element and multiply it by the corresponding cofactor.
Recursively apply this process until you reach a 2x2 matrix, which can be easily computed.
solutionHtml:
To expand the determinant along the first row, we'll use the formula:

\[\det(A) = a_{11}C_{11} + a_{12}C_{12} + ... + a_{1n}C_{1n}\]

where C_{ij} is the cofactor of A at position (i, j).

We'll then compute each cofactor recursively:

\[C_{11} = \det(A_{11})\] ...and so on.

",
problemHtml: Given the matrix A = [[3, 2], [1, 4]], expand its determinant along the first row.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Find the minor of a_{11}", "mathHtml": "\\[A_{11} = \\begin{bmatrix} 4 \\\\ -1 \\end{bmatrix}\]", "explanation": "The minor is obtained by removing the first row and column." }, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Compute the cofactor C_{11}", "mathHtml": "\\[C_{11} = \\det(A_{11}) = (4)(-1) - (-1)(2) = -8\]", "explanation": "The cofactor is the determinant of the minor." }, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Multiply a_{11} by C_{11}", "mathHtml": "\\[a_{11}C_{11} = (3)(-8) = -24\]" } ],
commonMistakes: Forgetting to multiply the cofactor by the corresponding element
